sailpoint.api
Class ObjectUtil

java.lang.Object
  sailpoint.api.ObjectUtil

public class ObjectUtil
extends java.lang.Object

Utility class providing methods to load and analyze SailPointObject subclasses.

Field Detail

MINIMUM_ENCODED_LENGTH

public static final int MINIMUM_ENCODED_LENGTH
The minimum length of any encoded string.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DEFAULT_LOCK_TIMEOUT

public static final int DEFAULT_LOCK_TIMEOUT
Default number of seconds waited before attempting to obtain a persistent lock before throwing ObjectAlreadyLockedException. Note that this MUST be less than the default amount of time used when expiring locks, which is currently hard coded in LockInfo at 5 minutes.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

BUILT_IN_SECRETS

public static final java.lang.String[] BUILT_IN_SECRETS
The names of secret attributes.

scrubPasswords

public static void scrubPasswords(ApprovalSet approvalSet)
Remove any secret values from the items in the given ApprovalSet. Note that this modifies the ApprovalSet.

isIdentifiedBy

public static boolean isIdentifiedBy(SailPointObject obj,
                                     java.lang.String id)
Return true if the given string matches either the name or id of the SailPointObject. This is used in a few places where identity comparison needs to be made with objects that might have been imported from test files, and these objects have "soft" references to some other object by name rather than id.

removeObjects

public static <T extends SailPointObject> int removeObjects(SailPointContext context,
                                                            java.lang.Class<T> cls,
                                                            QueryOptions ops)
                         throws GeneralException
Delete all the objects that match a search filter. Should only be used for modest sets, objects are brought in one at a time to avoid overloading the object cache.

Throws:
GeneralException

getContextIdentity

public static Identity getContextIdentity(SailPointContext context)
                                   throws GeneralException
Load the Identity that is considered the owner of the context.

Throws:
GeneralException

checkIllegalRename

public static void checkIllegalRename(SailPointContext context,
                                      SailPointObject obj)
                               throws GeneralException
Check to see if an object about to be saved has a name that is already being used by a different object. This is expected to be called by the UI prior to saving changes. If you do not you will get an obscure Hibernate "constraint violation" error with no clue as to what constraint was violated (but it is usually the name since there are not many not-null constraints).

Throws:
GeneralException

isIllegalRename

public static boolean isIllegalRename(SailPointContext context,
                                      SailPointObject obj)
                               throws GeneralException
Returns true of the given object has been renamed that is already being used.

This differs from checkIllegalRename in that it does not throw if it finds a name collision.

Throws:
GeneralException

generateUniqueName

public static java.lang.String generateUniqueName(SailPointContext ctx,
                                                  java.lang.String id,
                                                  java.lang.String name,
                                                  java.lang.Class clazz,
                                                  int count)
                                           throws GeneralException
Given the generated name for an objct, this method ensures that the name does not already exist. If it does, the count value is appended to the message. The method will continue to increment count until it finds a unique name.

Parameters:
ctx - Sailpoint context
id - The ID of the object
name - The current name
clazz - Class name
count - Current number to be appended if the name is a duplicate. 0 is never appended.
Returns:
A unique name for the object.
Throws:
GeneralException

checkIllegalRenameOrNewName

public static void checkIllegalRenameOrNewName(SailPointContext context,
                                               SailPointObject obj)
                                        throws GeneralException
Throw a GeneralException if the given object has a name that would cause an illegal rename exception.

Throws:
GeneralException
See Also:
ObjectUtil.isIllegalRename(SailPointContext, SailPointObject)

                                                            java.lang.Class clazz,

Throws:
GeneralException

recache

public static SailPointObject recache(SailPointContext con,
                                      SailPointObject src)
                               throws GeneralException
Take a detached object and "reswizzle" it so that any references it might have to other autonomous objects will be represented by objects in the given context (meaning the Hibernate cache).

This is necessary to avoid Hibernate errors such as "Found two representations of the same collection" when trying to restore objects that have been deserialized from XML THEN detached. This does not happen in many places, typically saveObject is called and a commit is done soon after XML parsing and the external references are still in the session. But in a few places like Workflower, RoleLifecycler, and TaskManager it is necessary to be able to save objects that were fetched or deXML'd and the hibernate session has since gone into an unknown state, often a full decache.

Throws:
GeneralException

recache

public static SailPointObject recache(SailPointContext con,
                                      SailPointObject src,
                                      boolean doAttach)
                               throws GeneralException
Parameters:
con - SailPointContext
src - SailPointObject to recache
doAttach - True if the object should be attached after the recache; false otherwise
Returns:
A recached copy of the source object.
Throws:
GeneralException
See Also:
ObjectUtil.recache(SailPointContext, SailPointObject)

reattach

public static <T extends SailPointObject> T reattach(SailPointContext ctx,
                                                     T o)
                                          throws GeneralException
Return an object with the same id as the given object that is attached to the session. This can be called after SailPointContext.decache() to get objects attached back to the session. Note that this does not return the same object, so if the calling code has any references to the object those should be replaced with the object returned from this method.

Throws:
GeneralException

reattachWithPrejudice

public static <T extends SailPointObject> T reattachWithPrejudice(SailPointContext ctx,
                                                                  java.lang.Class<T> objClass,
                                                                  T o)
                                                       throws GeneralException
Return an object with the same id as the given object that is attached to the session. This can be called after SailPointContext.decache() to get objects attached back to the session. Note that this does not return the same object, so if the calling code has any references to the object they should be replaced with the object returned from this method. This is just like the reattach() method except it bypasses the issues with CGLIB. This is especially useful when reattaching an object that was previously attached to a stale session but whose class is known.

Throws:
GeneralException

getOriginator

getObjects

public static <T extends SailPointObject> java.util.List<T> getObjects(SailPointContext context,
                                                                       java.lang.Class<T> cls,
                                                                       java.lang.Object something,
                                                                       boolean trustRuleReturns,

                                                                       boolean convertCSVToList,
                                                                       java.util.List<java.lang.String> notFoundNames)
                                                            throws GeneralException
Derive a list of objects from a value, typically a task argument or a rule result. The value can be of these forms: 

    - instance of the given class
    - name of an instance of the class
    - List of names of instances of the class
    - List of instances of the class
Throw if any names are unresolved.

getCertification

@Deprecated
public static Certification getCertification(SailPointContext context,
                                                        CertificationLink link)
                                      throws GeneralException
Deprecated. Most code should not be retrieving certifications from archives. If archive retrieval is required, this should be done explicitly using ObjectUtil.getCertificationArchive(SailPointContext, String).

Locate the referenced Certification, digging it out of an archive if necessary. Note that this should be treated as a read-only certification since it can be coming out of an archive. If you need to have a read/write certification, use getCertificationArchive() instead and save the modified Certification back in the archive with CertificatioArchive.rezipCertification(Certification).

Throws:
GeneralException

lockCertificationById

public static Certification lockCertificationById(SailPointContext context,
                                                  java.lang.String id,
                                                  int lockTimeout)
                                           throws GeneralException
Utility method to lock a certification by id. This will retain a lock for a longer duration than other locks because certification processing usually takes longer.

Currently it will use the value set in system configuration value Configuration.LONG_RUNNING_LOCK_TIMEOUT. If that value is missing it will use LockInfo.DEFAULT_LONG_LOCK_TIMEOUT

Parameters:
context - The SailPoint context
id - The ID of the certification to lock.
lockTimeout - How many seconds to try before giving up
Returns:
The locked certification or null if certification is already locked or lock cannot be obtained.
Throws:
GeneralException

relockObject

public static <T extends SailPointObject> T relockObject(SailPointContext con,
                                                         java.lang.Class<T> cls,
                                                         T object,
                                                         java.lang.String lockMode,
                                                         java.lang.String lockName,
                                                         int lockTimeout)
                                              throws GeneralException
Relock an object if the transaction was committed before this is completed. This can happen in Aggregator/Identitizer where it is hard to control when transactions are committed.

Throws:
GeneralException

unlockObject

public static void unlockObject(SailPointContext con,
                                SailPointObject object,
                                java.lang.String lockMode)
                         throws GeneralException
Unlock an object if it holds a persistent lock. This must be used during error cleanup if you have been obtaining persistent locks. If the this is a persistent lock the lock will be removed and the transaction committed. If this is a transasction lock, saveObject() will be called on the object but the transaction is not committed.

Throws:
GeneralException

lockIdentity

public static Identity lockIdentity(SailPointContext con,
                                    java.lang.String identifier,
                                    java.lang.String lockName,
                                    int timeout)
                             throws GeneralException
Convenience method to lock an Identity object using a persistent lock. The lock name will be a new unqiue identifier. Code that calls should always continue with a try block with a finally clause that calls unlockIdentity or releases the lock in some other way.

This the recommended way for system code and custom code to lock identities so unique persistent locks can be used consistently.

Parameters:
con - The SailPointContext to use.
identifier - The ID or name of the identity to lock.
lockName - The name of the lock, or null to generate a unique name.
timeout - The timeout in seconds, 0 for default.
Returns:
The locked identity.
Throws:
GeneralException

public static Identity lockIdentity(SailPointContext con,

                                    java.lang.String lockName)
                             throws GeneralException

getInvalidAttributes

public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getInvalidAttributes(Attributes<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> attributes,
                                                                    java.util.List<ObjectAttribute> validAttributeDefinitions,
                                                                    ObjectConfig config,
                                                                    java.util.Locale locale)
Verifies that all required attributes have a value. Also verifies that required String attributes are not blank.

Parameters:
attributes - Map of attribute values keyed by attribute name
validAttributeDefinitions - list of attributes that are valid for this role
config - Role Configuration
locale - Logged in user's locale
Returns:
List of attribute names for any attributes that do not have values or (in the case of Strings) have blank values. If no such attributes exist or if the attributes list was null an empty list is returned

getTempDir

public static java.lang.String getTempDir(SailPointContext ctx)
Get the location of the temp dir. Default to java.io.tmpdir but also check the system configuration Configuration.TEMP_DIR for an override.

doWithCertLock

public static <T> sailpoint.tools.Pair<java.lang.Boolean,T> doWithCertLock(SailPointContext context,
                                                                           Certification certification,
                                                                           java.util.concurrent.Callable<T> doWhat,
                                                                           boolean shouldUnlock,
                                                                           int lockTimeout)
                                                                throws GeneralException
Utility method which will create a persistent lock on the certifcation while performing a task. Transaction will be committed on successful completion if shouldUnlock is true.

Parameters:
context - SailPointContext
certification - the cert
doWhat - the task to perform. This task result is returned (see below).
shouldUnlock - true if unlocking should be done after the task is finished.
lockTimeout - How long to wait for the lock
Returns:
the first part of Pair object that is returned is whether this method executed successfully, the second part of the pair object is the result of running the task.
Throws:
GeneralException

getLCMWorkflowName

public static java.lang.String getLCMWorkflowName(SailPointContext ctx,
                                                  java.lang.String flowName)
                                           throws GeneralException
This will find the Workflow name based on the flow. What it does is prepends 'workflowLCM' to the flow name and tries to lookup a system configuration value set with that name

For example, if flowName is 'ResetPassword' it will lookup the system config property 'workflowLCMResetPassword' and that value will be returned.

Throws:
GeneralException

Returns the application associated with this Connector depending upon whether its a cloud based application or not

Parameters:
conn - Connector object whose application object is to be retrieved
